content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Service Cloud

What’s Service?

Set Up Service Cloud Basics

Design and Optimize the Agent Experience

Deflect Cases with Self-Service

Add Service Cloud Channels

Set Up Routing and Rules

Build AI Solutions with Einstein for Service

Track Service Metrics and Manage Your Team

Send Surveys with Feedback Management

Deliver Field Service

Provide Ethical Customer Service

Create the Social Action Interface

The social action is created when you install Social Customer Service. You can add, remove, and organize fields to suit your organization.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Social Customer Service is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Service Setup is available in Lightning Experience.
Social Customer Service is available in all editions with the Service Cloud.


USER
PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To administer Social Customer Service:	

Manage Users

AND

Customize Application


To create case feed items:	Feed Tracking for All Related Objects on the Case object
To make attachment download links public:	Create Public Links

The social action is created when Social Customer Service is enabled.

From the object management settings for cases, go to Button, Links, and Actions.
Click Layout next to the social action.
Edit the desired fields. Changing field values could invalidate incoming posts against the Social Customer Service Apex class.

To send social content, the social action must have the following fields:

In Reply To
Managed Social Account
Message Type
Content

The In Reply To field can’t be read only.

Headline and Name are required fields. To remove them, create a predefined value for each field and remove them from the action.

Click Save.
From the object management settings for cases, go to Page Layouts.
In Case Page Layouts, click Edit next to Feed-Based Layout.
In the palette, click Quick Actions.
Ensure that the social action is in the Quick Actions in the Salesforce Classic Publisher section of the layout.
title: Configuring the Social Action Interface in Salesforce
